key_points: President Biden addressed the nation on the terror attack at Hamid Karzai International Airport in Kabul.
The attack was carried out by ISIS-K, resulting in the deaths of American service members and civilians.
Biden has been in constant contact with military commanders and the situation is still evolving.
The President lauded the fallen and wounded service members as heroes part of a significant evacuation effort.
Over 100,000 individuals have been evacuated from Afghanistan in the last 11 days.
Biden expressed personal sorrow over the losses and emphasized a continuing obligation to the families of the fallen.
He promised retribution against the perpetrators: 'We will not forgive. We will not forget. We will hunt you down and make you pay.'
Biden has ordered the development of operational plans to strike ISIS-K assets, leadership, and facilities.
The mission to evacuate American citizens and Afghan allies will continue despite the attack.
Biden called for a moment of silence for those who have given their lives in service.
